question: ETL functions reshape the relevant data from the source systems into useful information.

question: Determine whether the beginning of one job in an extraction job stream has to wait until the previous job has finished successfully.
Determine how to handle input records that cannot be extracted.
All the extracted data must be made unusable in the data warehouse.
Data quality is not important in the data warehouse.
Beginning of the whole process of data transformation. Select either whole records or parts of several records from the source systems.
You will be splitting the selected parts even further during data transformation.
It is important task to make the fields usable and understandable to the users.
Rearrangement and simplification of individual fields to make them more useful for the data warehouse environment.
Major Transformation Types...
Populating all the data warehouse tables for the very first time.
Incremental Load — applying ongoing changes as necessary in a periodic manner.
Completely erasing the contents of one or more tables and reloading with fresh data.
The load process wipes out the existing data and applies the data from the incoming file.
Destructive Merge is an extension of the load.
Destructive Merge applies incoming data to the target data.
If the primary key of an incoming record matches with the key of an existing record, update the matching target record.
If the primary key of an incoming record matches with the key of an existing record, leave the existing record, add the incoming record, and mark the added record as superseding the old record.

What is a conformed dimension?

answers.a: A dimension used in different facts with the same meaning and value
answers.b: A dimension used multiple times within the same fact

question: What is a degenerate dimension?

answers.a: A dimension with no actual dimension table
answers.b: A dimension that changes slowly over time
answers.c: A dimension with multiple alternate versions

question: Which type of dimension is used for handling multi-valued dimensions?
What is the primary key of the Account-Insured_Person bridge table?

answers.a: Surrogate Account and Insured_Person foreign keys

question: What is a weighting factor in a bridge table?

answers.a: A way to allocate numeric additive facts across insured persons
answers.b: A way to identify primary policy holders
answers.c: A method to reduce data redundancy

question: How is a hot swappable dimension defined?

answers.a: A dimension that has multiple alternate versions that can be swapped at query time
answers.b: A dimension used multiple times within the same fact
answers.c: A dimension that changes rapidly over time

question: What is a role-playing dimension?

answers.a: A dimension used multiple times within the same fact but with different meanings
answers.c: A dimension used in different facts with the same meaning and value

question: Which data warehouse development approach is supported by Bill Inmon?
What is a key characteristic of the top-down approach?

answers.a: Analyze global business needs, plan, design, and implement as a whole
answers.c: Focus on a specific department's needs first

question: What is a key disadvantage of the top-down approach?

answers.a: High exposure to risk of failure

What is a key disadvantage of the bottom-up approach?

answers.c: A centralized data warehouse without dependent data marts

answers.a: Maintains data consistency across the enterprise

question: Inmon Data orientation is subject or data driven.
This architecture is a viable alternative to the independent DMs.
It allows for complex data queries across DMs.
This is perhaps the most famous data warehousing architecture today.
This architecture lacks the holistic enterprise view and may lead to data redundancy and data latency.
The centralized data warehouse architecture is similar to the hub-and-spoke architecture except that there are no dependent DMs.
This architecture provides users with access to all data in the data warehouse instead of limiting them to DMs.
Centralized data warehouse reduces the amount of data the technical team has to transfer or change.
This architecture provides a timely and holistic view of the enterprise to whoever, whenever, and wherever they may be within the organization.
What is a conformed dimension?

answers.a: A dimension used in different facts with the same meaning and value
answers.b: A dimension used multiple times within the same fact

question: A typical conformed dimension is the date. Its meaning varies by fact table.
A conformed dimension can refer to multiple tables in multiple data marts within the same organization.
What is a dimension key without corresponding dimension table?
A conformed dimension can be associated with different fact tables.
Degenerate dimensions are typically derived from the source data and are often codes or numbers that uniquely identify a transaction or an event.
Degenerate dimensions have no attributes other than a key. They are often used in fact tables to store values that are not part of any other dimension.
Degenerate dimensions do not have a dimension table because all the interesting attributes have been placed in analytic dimensions.
Degenerate dimensions are used to provide a grouping for business cases.
Degenerate dimensions are a type of dimension that have attributes.
What is a junk dimension?

answers.a: A dimension that involves combining low-cardinality fields or attributes into a single dimension table
answers.b: A dimension used in different facts with the same meaning and value
answers.c: A dimension with multiple alternate versions

question: These low-cardinality fields in a junk dimension may represent different categories or flags that have a limited number of possible values.
A junk dimension reduces the number of dimension tables in a data warehouse.
A junk dimension reduces the number of columns in the fact table.
A junk dimension optimizes space as fact tables should not include low-cardinality or text fields.
Junk dimensions are also called cross-reference dimensions.
In a junk dimension, each combination of the low-cardinality attributes is assigned a unique identifier.
Assigning a unique identifier in a junk dimension allows the dimension table to represent all the possible combinations of the attributes in a compact and efficient manner.
The original attributes are replaced with references to the surrogate key in fact tables in a junk dimension, reducing the overall data storage requirements.
Junk dimension advantages include:
By consolidating multiple low-cardinality attributes into a single dimension table, a junk dimension simplifies the data transformation process in ETL pipelines.
A conformed dimension can improve query performance by reducing the number of table joins required for querying data.
Putting attributes into an existing dimension is a better alternative than using a junk dimension.
Leaving attributes in the fact table instead of using a junk dimension results in a cluttered table with large row sizes and affects speed.
Making attributes into separate dimensions instead of using a junk dimension results in an overly complex model with too many tables, affecting speed and maintenance.
A 'customer type' flag with values like 'new,' 'returning,' or 'loyal' can be consolidated into a junk dimension.
Creating a junk dimension replaces hard-coded options in applications, making it easier to maintain and change these codes.
A role-played dimension refers to a technique where a single dimension table is used in multiple ways within the same fact table.
Role-playing dimensions help you analyze data from different perspectives without duplicating data.
An outrigger dimension is a secondary dimension table that is related to a primary dimension table in a star schema or snowflake schema.

Outrigger dimension is used in a star schema or snowflake schema.

In Outrigger Dimension example, to analyze sales of specific product variations or products with detailed specifications, we would join the fact table with the relevant outrigger dimensions based on the product_key.
From the Outrigger Dimension example, answer the following: Products dimension is not the primary dimension representing all products in the catalog.
This outrigger dimension captures attributes specific to product variations (e.g., different colors and sizes).
The fact table captures sales transactions, referencing both the base 'Products' dimension and the outrigger dimensions as needed.

If we want to analyze sales of a particular laptop model with a 15" screen and an Intel i5 processor, you would join the 'Sales' fact table with the 'Products' dimension and the 'Product Specifications' outrigger dimension using the product_key.
We use outrigger dimension for…
…allow you to separate detailed information from the primary dimension table.
Separating detailed information from the primary dimension table helps keep the primary dimension focused on essential attributes.
Adding new attributes directly to the primary dimension can lead to a wide, complex table.
Outrigger dimensions provide a modular way to add additional attributes without affecting the core structure.
…offer flexibility in adapting to changing business requirements.
By separating less frequently used attributes into an outrigger dimension, queries that do not require these details can avoid unnecessary joins, leading to improved query performance.
Changes to detailed attributes can be localized to the outrigger dimension, reducing the impact on the primary dimension.
…is a dimension that has a hierarchy of attributes.
…Dimensions have attributes that change over time.
Attributes that change over time. Products change price, cost, and composition. Employees are promoted, fired, this is a ….
Operational applications do not track changes to dimensional values because transactions only need the most current values.
Which Slowly changing Dimension type keeps original data?
Which Slowly changing Dimension type overwrites existing data (row) with new data?
Which Slowly changing Dimension type creates a new row for new values?
Which Slowly changing Dimension type tracks changes using separate columns but overwrites the rest?
Which Slowly changing Dimension type adds a mini-dimension?
The technique that writes the original dimension record but then never updates it is…
SCD type 0 is the least likely technique to be used.
In SCD type 1 we do not lose the ability to track the history of the attributes.
SCD type 2 enables you to track history accurately.
SCD type 2 is relatively straightforward to implement.
In SCD type 4 we split the data into two tables, one for the current record and one for the historical data.
When we have a dimension with one or more of its attributes changing very fast, this is called a Fast Changing Dimension.
Separation of the attributes into one or more dimensions is also called…
